parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post contains a CMF number (CMF 11240015) at the end. This strongly suggests electoral propaganda, as CMF numbers are used for tracking and reporting campaign spending, mandated for candidates.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly mentions Brian Cristian, identifying him as a candidate for the parliamentary elections from USR Maramureș.  The image further reinforces this by showing his picture and party affiliation (USR). This clearly satisfies "Article 36 (7) - a".</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>As a paid Facebook post, the content is designed to reach a wide audience, not just a select few.  The use of hashtags further indicates an attempt to broaden reach and engagement. This satisfies "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The primary objective of the post is to encourage voters to support Brian Cristian in the parliamentary elections.  Phrases like "Votați reprezentanți care muncesc pentru voi," "Candidez pentru un nou mandat," and "Vă îndemn să mă susțineți" explicitly aim to influence voting behavior. This satisfies "Article 36 (7) - c".</electoral-objective>
<journalism>While the post presents some factual information (attendance record), it's primarily framed as a campaign message, not objective journalism. The inclusion of opinions and calls to action outweighs any informational value presented in a journalistic manner.  The post does not adhere to journalistic standards of objectivity and neutrality.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The post goes beyond expressing a personal opinion; it actively solicits votes and promotes a specific candidate. The mention of other candidates (Elena Lasconi) is used to further the campaign message, not to offer an independent political analysis.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>472301982091367</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post fulfills all criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. It refers directly to a candidate (Brian Cristian), targets a wide audience through a paid Facebook advertisement, and has the clear objective of influencing voters to support him in the parliamentary elections. The presence of a CMF number further strengthens this conclusion.  The post's content, while including some factual data, is overwhelmingly promotional in nature and lacks the objectivity expected of journalistic reporting.  The mention of Elena Lasconi serves to bolster the campaign message, not to provide an independent political commentary.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Brian Cristian</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>Elena Lasconi</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>USR</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
USR Maramureș, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, a unei postări pe Facebook (ID 472301982091367) cu conținut electoral, care promovează candidatura lui Brian Cristian la alegerile parlamentare și conține îndemnuri explicite la vot ("Votați reprezentanți care muncesc pentru voi", "Candidez pentru un nou mandat", "Vă îndemn să mă susțineți"),  precum și un număr CMF (CMF 11240015),  având ca efect electoral influențarea votului în favoarea candidatului Brian Cristian și, indirect, Elena Lasconi,  în clară încălcare a prevederilor legale privind perioada de campanie electorală.  Postarea, deși conține unele date factuale, este preponderent de natură promoțională, lipsită de obiectivitatea necesară unui material jurnalistic.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
